name: Hotel Kipling - Manotel Geneva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Kipling in Geneva on the advice and recommendations found in Trip Advisor. We were certainly not disappointed. The hotel was lovely. Beautifully and stylishly decorated and very warm. The bedrooms were of a reasonable size and very comfortable with tea/coffee making facilities free and Television which could receive ITV and BBC2 as well as numerous other foreign stations,
reviews.title: Great hotel with exceptional staff.

reviews.text: The breakfasts as warned were expensive at 18 chf - approximately £11 but we considered them to be very good indeed with a good selection of fruit juices, cold meats, cheeses, fruit, cereals, pastries as well as scrambled eggs, sausages and beans. In fact by Geneva prices generally it was good value. The breakfast area itself was tasteful and intimate.
reviews.title: Excellent location / Friendly and Very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An outstanding feature of the hotel was the friendliness and courtesy of all the staff. Probably the best we have come across on our travels. On arrival we were greeted warmly and everything was explained to us. We were given a password for free internet use and passes that enabled free access to all public transport in Geneva and this included the boat, and train to the airport as well as the trams. Every time we left or entered the hotel staff smiled and wished us a good time.
reviews.title: Deserves all the praise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the Hotel is not great. As many others who have submitted reviews have pointed out it is in a multi-ethnic area and bordering on the red light district. However routes are available to avoid this and even if not, it is non- threatening. The location is good for easy access to the railway station. Arriving from Geneva airport look out for a small yellow machine which gives free rail transport tickets to the city. The journey takes only ten minutes. The airport station is a short walk and clearly signed. Don't worry which train you get on as they all stop at Geneva station.
reviews.title: Raj Inspired Design Theme gives this Great Value 4 Star-Style Hotel Must-Stay Appeal

reviews.text: The hotel is a short walk from the station and unless laden with luggage you would not need an expensive taxi. Leave the station at the front entrance - it is a bit misleading - but coming down the ramp look for the sign and turn right and this will lead you to the main street. Cross the tramlines and road directly opposite the station and turn left along the road for about two hundred metres. The Hotel Kipling is down a side street on the right hand side.
reviews.title: Very good value for the money, though not in a top location; though convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in Hotel Kipling in December 2009. The hotel is not even a five minute walk from the train station and is very close to the Avis and Europcar offices. The room wasn't huge but was large enough and the bathroom was simple but clean. The television in the room has english channels and the hotel offers complementary internet with two dedicated terminals. The breakfast buffet was good and offered a wide range of food. We were able to walk quickly and easily into town and didn't end up using the transport passes we were given by the hotel. The staff were charming and eager to please.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Geneva
Great hotel
reviews.text: The only problem is the lack of restaurant which we were aware of when we booked the hotel. We tried two of the sister hotels both of which didn't start serving until 1900, which is fine unless your jetlagged and want to go to bed early! We had a very expensive and poor quality bar meal at the Hotel Royal. The serving of soup was small and the hamburger was undercooked. We did have a reasonable meal at the Novatel which is just two streets away and they have a bar where you can sit and have a drink.
Would i stay there again... probably, its good value for money and centrally located in a quaint town.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel experience. Staff was friendly and informative. Rooms were well appointed, and location was just a couple of blocks from the train station (hop on one of the free trams for the short trip). We booked two rooms, one for us and one for our teens. The rooms were at the end of the hallway, with a small foyer. We were able to lock the door to the foyer and open our rooms up to each other, giving us more space if we wanted it. Neighborhood was nothing special but seemed safe, and getting around Geneva is easy.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in the heart of Geneva
Hotel Kipling
reviews.text: Beautifully designed hotel that is a great place to stay. Rooms are small but well furnished and have a valuable asset in a kettle so if you've been out for the day you can come back and have a hot drink - also useful for breakfast if you want to go out to buy some food and eat in the room as the SFr 18 buffet breakfast is pricey (though to be fair this is not much more than Big Mac meal so maybe it just reflects prices in Switzerland).

Great hotel to stay in - really close to the train station so perfect for the airport. You can then walk in about 15 minutes to the old town or you get the tram/bus from the station which is very easy. Hotel rooms are modern and a good size. Bathroom is also very good with a good shower. Breakfast is nice but probably overpriced if not included in your package. Geneva is easy to get around. .. rent the free bikes from near the Paquis pier and visit the United Nations.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in Geneva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Room large, bath modern. Location quite convenient to train station which is convenient to airport via free rail transfer. Breakfast extra and while we did not partake, it looked nice. Found restaurants very expensive. Opted for take away for dinner. Also purchased breakfast items. Found Coop downtown to have great selection of food items and wines. On floor above basement level store there is hot food and dessert takeaway operation. Room very comfortable for breakfast and dinner. Saved oodles of money and ate very well. Free use of computer a nice touch. Between old town/downtown area and international section. Not in either, but convenient to both. For price, ambiance, location, would definitely choose Kipling again.
reviews.title: excellent choice

reviews.text: The staff was really really nice and very helpful. The lobby is very pretty (modern), and the rooms were so well appointed--plush bed, plush pillows, great bathroom, lots of towels and washcloths, nice toiletries, no noise, perfect temperature, great location near the train station, even a good TV. Everything about the hotel was comfortable. Excellent value for the cost, it really felt like a 4 star, and actually was in better condition than some 5 stars we've stayed in throughout the EU. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Should be a 4 star not a 3

reviews.text: As to Lake Geneva, I was surprised it was as "industrial" looking as it was. Still pretty, but industrial is the only word I can think of.
reviews.title: Best Mid-Range Hotel in Central Geneva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic staff, lovely room and great breakfast.
reviews.title: Fun and Convenient to the Train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel; clean and modern with efficient attentive staff. The quality of the décor and fittings were absolutely superb. It is very well located near the train station and in a very culturally diverse part of Geneva. A tram stop giving access to all parts of the city was just at the top of the street and the station is only a short walk away. The only omission was a heated towel rail but this was only because we like to be environmentally friendly and don’t expect a fresh towel every day. We stayed on a room only basis but there were 50% discount vouchers provided for the breakfast which we didn’t take up, we tended to leave the hotel late and go straight for lunch! I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for any stopover, free wireless internet access and a small business centre should meet the needs of the business traveller too.
reviews.title: Immaculate hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended. We were here for a long weekend visiting a friend. As we thought Switzerland is an expensive country but we thought the hotel was well worth the amount we paid and it's great value. The hotel had nice interiors (quite oriental theme), was very clean and the service was very helpful and attentive. We arrived to check in and the concierge gave us a pass for free public transport around Geneva. During our stay, the staff were very helpful, going the 'extra mlle' on every request. Defiantly an underrated hotel and very good value for money.
reviews.title: More than 3 stars - Great value and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: It's easy to see why this hotel's climbing Tripadvisor's chart

reviews.text: Since then it's climbed to No. 3 and there's been quite a few more favourable reviews.
reviews.title: Charming, clean, atmospheric hotel

reviews.text: The most recent posts sum up everything my wife and i found about it.
reviews.title: Perfect high quality low cost base for business or leisure

description: A journey of discovery. India, the Orient and beyond. With its furbishings inspired by exotic lands, the Hotel Kipling takes you to another world, a profusion of fragrances, colours and sensuality. City centre, near the Geneva lake and main station. 62 rooms and suites with air-conditioning. Kitchenettes. Minibar, Interactive TV. Business center free of charge. WiFi and internet connection free of charge. Laundry.
